alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_bounds_factors: ap: ap_bnds b: b_bnds ps: ps
alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: ap: ap b: b ps: ps

dbze.long_name: CloudSat simulator equivalent radar reflectivity factor

depth2000m.long_name: coordinate value for 2000 m ocean depth

depth300m.long_name: coordinate value for 300 m ocean depth

depth700m.long_name: coordinate value for 700 m ocean depth

hybrid_height.z_bounds_factors: a: lev_bnds b: b_bnds orog: orog
hybrid_height.z_factors: a: lev b: b orog: orog

ocean_double_sigma.formula: for k <= k_c:n z(k,j,i)= sigma(k)*f(j,i) n for k > k_c:n z(k,j,i)= f(j,i) + (sigma(k)-1)*(depth(j,i)-f(j,i)) n f(j,i)= 0.5*(z1+ z2) + 0.5*(z1-z2)* tanh(2*a/(z1-z2)*(depth(j,i)-href))
ocean_double_sigma.z_bounds_factors: sigma: sigma_bnds depth: depth z1: z1 z2: z2 a: a href: href k_c: k_c
ocean_double_sigma.z_factors: sigma: sigma depth: depth z1: z1 z2: z2 a: a_coeff href: href k_c: k_c

ocean_s.formula: z(n,k,j,i) = eta(n,j,i)*(1+s(k)) + depth_c*s(k) + (depth(j,i)-depth_c)*C(k) n where n C(k)=(1-b)*sinh(a*s(k))/sinh(a) +n           b*(tanh(a*(s(k)+0.5))/(2*tanh(0.5*a)) - 0.5)
ocean_s.z_bounds_factors: s: lev_bnds eta: eta depth: depth a: a b: b depth_c: depth_c
ocean_s.z_factors: s: lev eta: eta depth: depth a: a_coeff b: b_coeff depth_c: depth_c

ocean_sigma.z_bounds_factors: sigma: lev_bnds eta: eta depth: depth
ocean_sigma.z_factors: sigma: lev eta: eta depth: depth

ocean_sigma_z.formula: for k <= nsigma: z(n,k,j,i) = eta(n,j,i) + sigma(k)*(min(depth_c,depth(j,i))+eta(n,j,i)) ; for k > nsigma: z(n,k,j,i) = zlev(k)
ocean_sigma_z.z_bounds_factors: sigma: sigma_bnds eta: eta depth: depth depth_c: depth_c nsigma: nsigma zlev: zlev_bnds
ocean_sigma_z.z_factors: sigma: sigma eta: eta depth: depth depth_c: depth_c nsigma: nsigma zlev: zlev

smooth_level.z_bounds_factors: a: a_bnds b1: b1_bnds b2: b2_bnds ztop: ztop zsurf1: zsurf1 zsurf2: zsurf2
smooth_level.z_factors: a: a b1: b1 b2: b2 ztop: ztop zsurf1: zsurf1 zsurf2: zsurf2

standard_hybrid_sigma.z_bounds_factors: p0: p0 a: a_bnds b: b_bnds ps: ps
standard_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: p0: p0 a: a b: b ps: ps

standard_sigma.z_bounds_factors: ptop: ptop sigma: lev_bnds ps: ps
standard_sigma.z_factors: ptop: ptop sigma: lev ps: ps

time3.long_name: Diurnal cycle: monthly mean of the diurnal cycle (1 hour steps).

ps.comment: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

p0.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: reference pressure

orog.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. Altitude is the (geometric) height above the geoid, which is the reference geopotential surface. The geoid is similar to mean sea level.

depth.long_name: Sea Floor Depth: formula term: thetao

eta.long_name: Sea Surface Height formula term: thetao

albisccp.comment: ISCCP Mean Cloud Albedo. Time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction (cltisccp) - see  http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html

clcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover at CALIPSO standard heights.

clhcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 220hPa

clic.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
clic.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clis.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice
clis.comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clisccp.comment: Percentage cloud cover in optical depth categories.

cllcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 840hPa

clmcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa

cltisccp.comment: Percentage total cloud cover, simulating ISCCP observations.

clwc.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
clwc.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clws.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water
clws.comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

dmc.comment: The net mass flux  represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.   This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

hur.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

mcd.comment: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

mcu.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The atmosphere convective mass flux is the vertical transport of mass for a field of cumulus clouds or thermals, given by the product of air density and vertical velocity. For an area-average, cell_methods should specify whether the average is over all the area or the area of updrafts only.

parasolRefl.comment: Simulated reflectance from PARASOL as seen at the top of the atmosphere for 5 solar zenith angles. Valid only over ocean and for one viewing direction (viewing zenith angle of 30 degrees and relative azimuth angle 320 degrees).

pctisccp.comment: ISCCP Mean Cloud Top Pressure. Time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction (clitisccp) - see  http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html

rld.comment: Downwelling Longwave Radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rldcs.comment: Downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rlu.comment: Upwelling longwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rlucs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky rongwave radiation  (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rsd.comment: Downwelling shortwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and top-of-atmosphere)

rsdcs.comment: Downwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and top-of-atmosphere)

rsu.comment: Upwelling shortwave radiation  (includes also the fluxes at the surface and top of atmosphere)

rsucs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation  (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

smc.comment: The net mass flux represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme, this is calculated as convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

tnhusa.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Advection
tnhusa.comment: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Advection

tnhusc.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Convection

tnhusd.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Diffusion
tnhusd.comment: Tendency of specific humidity due to numerical diffusion.This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.

tnhusmp.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Model Physics
tnhusmp.comment: Tendency of specific humidity due to model physics. This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.

tnhusscpbl.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Stratiform Cloud Condensation and Evaporation
tnhusscpbl.comment: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing  (to be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all bounday layer terms including and diffusive terms.)

tnsccw.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water In Air

tnsccwa.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water due to Advection
tnsccwa.comment: condensed water includes both liquid and ice.

tnsccwacr.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water due to Autoconversion to Rain
tnsccwacr.comment: condensed water includes both liquid and ice.

tnsccwacs.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water due to Autoconversion to Snow
tnsccwacs.comment: condensed water includes both liquid and ice.

tnsccwbl.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water In Air Due To Boundary Layer Mixing

tnsccwce.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water due to Condensation and Evaporation
tnsccwce.comment: condensed water includes both liquid and ice.

tnsccwcm.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water In Air Due To Cloud Microphysics

tnsccwif.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water due to Icefall
tnsccwif.comment: condensed water includes both liquid and ice.

tnscli.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice In Air

tnsclia.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Advection

tnscliag.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Aggregation

tnsclias.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Accretion to Snow

tnsclibfpcl.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice In Air Due To Bergeron Findeisen Process from Cloud Liquid

tnsclibl.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice In Air Due To Boundary Layer Mixing

tnsclicd.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice Due Convective Detrainment

tnsclicm.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice In Air Due To Cloud Microphysics

tnsclids.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Deposition and Sublimation

tnscliemi.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Evaporation of Melting Ice

tnsclihencl.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Heterogeneous Nucleation From Cloud Liquid

tnsclihenv.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Heterogeneous Nucleation From Water Vapor

tnsclihon.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Homogeneous Nucleation

tnscliif.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Icefall

tnsclimcl.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Melting to Cloud Liquid

tnsclimr.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Melting to Rain

tnscliricl.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Riming From Cloud Liquid

tnsclirir.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Riming From Rain

tnsclw.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water In Air

tnsclwa.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Advection

tnsclwac.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Autoconversion

tnsclwar.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Accretion to Rain

tnsclwas.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Accretion to Snow

tnsclwbfpcli.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water In Air Due To Bergeron Findeisen Process To Cloud Ice

tnsclwbl.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water In Air Due To Boundary Layer Mixing

tnsclwcd.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water Due to Convective Detrainment

tnsclwce.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Condensation and Evaporation

tnsclwcm.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water In Air Due To Cloud Microphysics

tnsclwhen.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Heterogeneous Nucleation

tnsclwhon.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Homogeneous Nucleation

tnsclwmi.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Melting From Cloud Ice

tnsclwri.long_name: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Riming

tnta.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection
tnta.comment: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection

tntc.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Moist Convection

tntmp.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Diabatic Processes
tntmp.comment: Tendency of air temperature due to model physics. his includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.

tntr.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Radiative Heating
tntr.comment: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Radiative Heating

tntscpbl.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
tntscpbl.comment: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing (to be specified only in  models which do not separate cloud, precipitation and boundary layer terms.  Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive ones.)

rld4co2.comment: Downwelling longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rldcs4co2.comment: Downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rlu4co2.comment: Upwelling longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rlucs4co2.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rsd4co2.comment: Downwelling shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

rsdcs4co2.comment: Downwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

rsu4co2.comment: Upwelling Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

rsucs4co2.comment: Upwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

rlut4co2.comment: Top-of-atmosphere outgoing longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

rlutcs4co2.long_name: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
rlutcs4co2.comment: Top-of-atmosphere outgoing clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

rsut4co2.long_name: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation in 4XCO2 Atmosphere
rsut4co2.comment: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

rsutcs4co2.long_name: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
rsutcs4co2.comment: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold
